main event: The UFO report contains sightings of unidentified objects near Great Falls AFB, Montana in 1953 by both military personnel and civilian observers on multiple occasions. The objects were described as bright, glowing lights maneuvering at high speeds and altitudes.
interesting points: Lieutenant Peter Marquart and Sgt. Dwyer M. Montana observed a bright, glowing object in the sky at an altitude of 1,000 to 5,000 feet, which maneuvered similarly to bursting a parachute flare.
The civilian man observed an unidentified aerial object on three separate occasions in February 1953 - 25 Feb 53 at 0052Z, 5 Mar 53 at 2115Z, and 6 Mar 53 at 1952Z.
The object appeared to disintegrate, resembling a parachute flare, after descending to a very low altitude and then climbed rapidly at great speed.
The report indicates that there were multiple witnesses to the sightings, including military ground observers at the 1701st ATW, MATS, Great Falls Airport, Montana.

There were requests for further investigation, information on the observer's experience level, and advice to check into Mr. Lee's character, local reputation, and the possibility of the sightings being the result of a 'crackpot'.
sighted object: multiple bright, glowing unidentified aerial objects maneuvering at high speeds and altitudes
